column1: please show this one step by step: MP 2: New Clear REACTive App

column2: you will implement a front-end interface using React that consumes an API. Please read through the entire MP before you start.

column1: Create a single-page React app that lets users interact with the data from one of the following APIs.
More APIs if you want to explore here (please keep it class appropriate) ü´µü§®üì∏.
Note that you may need to create an account and/or acquire an API key for some of the APIs. GitHub won‚Äôt restrict you from pushing API keys
column2: but may send an email to say some keys are exposed. Because of this
column3: please don't use any paid APIs.

column1: The API you are working with may become temporarily unavailable. If/when this happens
column2: it doesn't mean you are blocked from working on the MP. You can mock the data
column3: i.e. create a local hard coded response and use that instead of making the request.

column1: You may need to deal with APIs having rate-limiting policies. You can find ways to get around them like caching the results of large and common API calls
These are also good opportunities to think about how your app should handle errors.
Your app should have the following features:

A list view: where users can input a query into a search bar and the app returns a list of results that match the query (i.e. searching movies or pokemon). There should also be a way to sort the search results based on different properties of the results (such as the name or rank) and of specifying an ordering (ascending and descending). Also
column2: the search bar should filter as you type. You can sort and filter in the client side.

column1: A gallery view: that displays some kind of image media from the chosen API (gallery of movie posters). The gallery view should also have some kind filtering attribute where users can select one or many attributes and filter the gallery by them (i.e. genres of films or music).
A detail view: When an item in the search view or the gallery view is clicked
column2: the app should display the different attributes of the selected item. Also
column3: this view should have previous and next buttons (can be implemented with arrows) that lets the user cycle through the list of objects. A detail view should have a specific route when navigated to. Basically
column4: a user should be able to access the detail route through a specific url.

column1: Here's an old example that fulfills these requirements: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DmDZuAr7QJE
You will also be required to use following tools:
Does the list view display relevant items from the chosen API ? (4 points)
Does the search bar filter down items based on the search? (8 points)
Can you sort by at least 2 properties? (8 points)
Can the properties be sorted in Ascending and Descending order? (8 points)
Is the gallery composed of item media? (4 points)
Does clicking on a filter change results accordingly? (8 points)
Does clicking on an item in List View take you to the Details View? (10 points)
Does clicking on an item in Gallery View take you to the Details View? (10 points)
Does the Details View contain item details? (8 points)
Do the PREVIOUS and NEXT buttons work correctly? (10 points)
Does the implementation use React Router and TypeScript? (12 points)
Start early! This is first MP that uses React so start ahead.
Visit https://reactjs.org/docs/faq-structure.html for examples on how to structure your React files.
You may use a React component library for this MP.
This is an individual assignment. No collaboration is permitted.
It is not permitted to copy/paste code that is not your own. You are
column3: free to look at different code sources for inspiration and clarity. All sources (code as well as reading material) that you reference to complete this assignment must be declared in the submission.

No inline script tags should be used.
HTML tables cannot be used for layout.

column1: Use Create React App (CRA) (see below) to generate your MP starter code in a directory of your choice.

column2: high quality resources to help get you started.

column1: create-react-app is a tool that allows you to generate a react starter project that requires no immediate configuration. Visit the getting started guide to read more. You should use create-react-app with the Typescript template.
You may be wondering how the command npx create-react-app my-app --template typescript works and why there is no installation step. Click here for an explanation of npx.
Here's what you will need to submit:
Clone the repository git clone git@github.com:cs409-fa25/mp2.git

Perfect! I've updated the instructions parsing to eliminate all numbered format "N." from the instructions text.
- **Before**: Instructions were parsed to preserve numbered steps like "1."
- **New approach**: Split instructions by sentence endings (`.`

This simplifies the display by removing all the problematic numbering formats while maintaining readable instruction steps. The instructions will now appear as clean bullet points without any number prefixes.
